isis.stitle: POWER STEERING GEAR: TRW/ROSS-TAS 40, 55, 65 AND 85 - ADJUST - POPPET RE-ADJUSTMENT

svcproc.title: POPPET RE-ADJUSTMENT
svcproc.para: This resetting procedure will work in most cases with at least 1-3/4 hand-wheel- turns from each side of center. If you are making a large reduction in wheel cut and this procedure does not work, you may have to replace or internally reset the poppets using the procedure described in the POPPET COMPONENT.

step1.para: Set the axle stops. Refer to GROUP 02 - STEERING GENERAL INFORMATION AND ALIGNMENT in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Start the engine and allow the vehicle to idle for 5 to 10 minutes to warm the hydraulic fluid. Shut off the engine.
If a new poppet adjusting screw and jam nut are being used, turn the screw into the non-sealing end of the jam nut until the drive end of the screw is flush with the nut ( Figure 145).

figure.caption: Figure 145. Drive End of Screw Flush With Nut

step1.para: Your steering gear will have either a fixed stop bolt or an adjusting screw. If the adjusting screw is already part of the steering gear, back the jam nut off the adjusting screw until it is flush with the end of the adjusting screw.

Make sure the engine is off and the road wheels are in the straight ahead position. Remove and discard the poppet fixed bolt (if equipped) and washer (if equipped) from the lower end of the housing ( Figure 146).
If the unit has a poppet adjusting screw and jam nut that need to be replaced, remove and discard them.

Turn the adjusting screw and jam nut assembly, without rotating the nut on the screw, into the housing until the jam nut is firmly against the housing using 7/32 inch Allen wrench. Tighten the jam nut against the housing ( Figure 147).

figure.caption: Figure 147. Tighten Jam Nut Against Housing

caution.para: If the drive end of the screw is below the face of the jam nut, the poppet seal flange will break during step 7C.

step1.para: Refill the system reservoir with approved hydraulic fluid.

caution.para: Do not mix fluid types. Mixing of transmission fluid, motor oil, or other hydraulic fluids will cause seals to deteriorate faster.

step1.para: Place a jack under the center of the front axle and jack up the front end of the vehicle so the steer axle tires are off the ground ( Figure 148).
Start the engine and let it run at idle speed.

step2.para: Note which output shaft timing mark is nearest the housing piston bore.
Turn the steering wheel in the direction that makes this timing mark move toward the adjusting screw just installed. Turn in this direction until axle stop contact is made.
Pull hard on the steering wheel (put up to 40 lbs. rim pull on a 20 inch diameter steering wheel) after the axle stop is contacted.

step1.para: Turn the steering wheel in the opposite direction (end of timing mark away from adjusting screw) until the other axle stop is contacted.
Pull hard on the steering wheel (put up to 40 lbs. rim pull on a 20 inch diameter steering wheel).

svcproc.para: Release the steering wheel and shut off the engine.

step1.para: Loosen the jam nut, hold with a wrench, and back the adjusting screw out until 1 inch is past the nut. Tighten the jam nut against the housing ( Figure 149).

figure.caption: Figure 149. Tighten Jam Nut Against Housing

caution.para: Do not hold the steering wheel at full turn for more than 10 seconds at a time; the heat build-up at pump relief pressure may damage components.

step1.para: Start the engine and let it idle.
Turn the steering wheel in the original direction (end of timing mark toward adjusting screw) until axle stop contact is made ( Figure 150).
Hold the steering wheel in this position (with up to 40 lbs. rim pull) for 10 seconds, then release. Repeat this hold and release process as many times as necessary while completing step 11.
With steering wheel held tightly at full turn, loosen the jam nut and hold it in place with a wrench.

Turn the adjusting screw in (clockwise) using finger-pressure only (don't use a ratchet) until the Allen wrench stops ( Figure 151). Do not attempt to turn it in further. Pause the turning-in process each time the driver releases the steering wheel; continue turning only while the wheel is held at full turn.

svcproc.para: Back off the adjusting screw 3-1/4 turns and tighten the jam nut to 35 ft-lbs. (47 N•m).

step1.para: The poppets have now been completely reset. Lower the vehicle. Check the reservoir and fill if required.

important.para: The length of the adjusting screw beyond the jam nut must be no more than 1-1/16 inch for proper thread engagement.

note.para: The length of the adjusting screw beyond the jam nut may be different for each vehicle.
